thread.title: Blues forward Stastny out at least 5 weeks with broken foot
thread.title_full: Blues forward Stastny out at least 5 weeks with broken foot

title: Blues forward Stastny out at least 5 weeks with broken foot
text:
Sports Blues forward Stastny out at least 5 weeks with broken foot St. Louis Blues’ Paul Stastny (26) scores a goal on Edmonton Oilers goalie Cam Talbot (33) during the third period of an NHL hockey game Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in Edmonton, Alberta. (Jason Franson/The Canadian Press via AP) more > By - Associated   
ST. LOUIS (AP) - St. Louis Blues forward Paul Stastny will be sidelined at least five weeks with a broken right foot. 
The 29-year-old Stastny was injured in the second period of a 4-3 victory in Vancouver on Friday. He has a goal, four assists and a plus-four rating in five games. 
The team placed Stastny on injured reserve Wednesday and said the injury will be re-evaluated in five weeks. 
Stastny was hampered by a shoulder injury last season, his first with the Blues. He had 46 points in 74 games.
